verses.verse: A Song <S%H7892><s%> of degrees. <S%H4609><s%> In my distress <S%H6869><s%> I cried <S%H7121><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and he heard <S%H6030><s%> me.
Deliver <S%H5337><s%> my soul, <S%H5315><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> from lying <S%H8267><s%> lips, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8193><s%> and from a deceitful <S%H7423><s%> tongue. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3956><s%>
What <S%H4100><s%> shall be given <S%H5414><s%> unto thee? or what <S%H4100><s%> shall be done <S%H3254><s%> unto thee, thou false <S%H7423><s%> tongue? <S%H3956><s%>
Sharp <S%H8150><s%> arrows <S%H2671><s%> of the mighty, <S%H1368><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> coals <S%H1513><s%> of juniper. <S%H7574><s%>
Woe <S%H190><s%> is me, that <S%H3588><s%> I sojourn <S%H1481><s%> in Mesech, <S%H4902><s%> that I dwell <S%H7931><s%> in <S%H5973><s%> the tents <S%H168><s%> of Kedar! <S%H6938><s%>
My soul <S%H5315><s%> hath long <S%H7227><s%> dwelt <S%H7931><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> him that hateth <S%H8130><s%> peace. <S%H7965><s%>
I <S%H589><s%> am for peace: <S%H7965><s%> but when <S%H3588><s%> I speak, <S%H1696><s%> they <S%H1992><s%> are for war. <S%H4421><s%>
